claim: If bitcoin has gone up in value over the past twenty years, bitcoin will go down in the next twenty years.

supporting.text: Past performance of an asset does not guarantee future performance, so bitcoin's past increase does not necessarily predict a future decrease.

attacks.text: Past performance of an asset does not guarantee future performance, so bitcoin's past increase does not necessarily predict a future decrease.

Bitcoin's market is still relatively inefficient due to limited institutional participation and regulatory uncertainty, making past trends potentially informative.
